qas.question: What is the date of the earliest known human activity on Cyprus?
What is Cyprus home to of?

answers.text: the oldest water wells in the world

qas.question: Who was Cyprus settled by in 2nd millennium BC?

answers.text: empires of the Assyrians, Egyptians and Persians

qas.question: When did Ottoman rule occur in Cyprus?

context: The earliest known human activity on the island dates to around the <a0_0>10th millennium BC<a0_0/>. Archaeological remains from this period include the well-preserved Neolithic village of Khirokitia, and Cyprus is home to some of <a1_0>the oldest water wells in the world<a1_0/>. Cyprus was settled by <a2_0>Mycenaean Greeks<a2_0/> in two waves in the 2nd millennium BC. As a strategic location in the Middle East, it was subsequently occupied by several major powers, including the <a3_0>empires of the Assyrians, Egyptians and Persians<a3_0/>, from whom the island was seized in 333 BC by Alexander the Great. Subsequent rule by Ptolemaic Egypt, the Classical and Eastern Roman Empire, Arab caliphates for a short period, the French Lusignan dynasty and the Venetians, was followed by over three centuries of Ottoman rule <a4_0>between 1571 and 1878<a4_0/> (de jure until 1914).
